title: Rose Byrne channels feminist Gloria Steinem for new show Mrs America
text:
Rose Byrne looks the part as feminist icon Gloria Steinem (Pictures: Mega/REX)

Rose Byrne was channelling peak girl power with her Gloria Steinem look for upcoming TV drama miniseries, Mrs America.

The 40-year-old Aussie actress took to the streets of Manhattan on Sunday in a wig and paisley mini dress alongside love interest in the show, Jay Ellis.

The pair held hands and kissed on the sidewalk, then Rose rocked up and posed in front of a bunch of paparazzi.

Rose Byrne is ultimate girl power as feminist icon Gloria Steinem (Picture: SteveSands/NewYorkNewswire/MEGA)

Rose Byrne and Jay Ellis get up close and personal while filming Mrs America (Picture: SteveSands/NewYorkNewswire/MEGA)

Rose Byrne poses for the TV cameras as Gloria Steinem (Picture: SteveSands/NewYorkNewswire/MEGA)

Mrs America will tell the story of the feminist movement in America during the 60s and 70s.

It follows the lives of prominent figures in the movement as they try to ratify the Equal Rights Amendment.

Cate Blanchett stars as constitutional lawyer Phyllis Schlafly – who leads an unexpected fight against the movement – while Uzo Aduba portrays politician Shirley Chisholm, and Elizabeth Banks stars as special White House assistant Jill Ruckelshaus.

It also features other celebs like Sarah Paulson, James Marsden, Tracey Ullman, and John Slattery.

Rose Byrne looks the part as feminist icon Gloria Steinem (Pictures: SteveSands/NewYorkNewswire/MEGA)

According to the show’s official synopsis, it ‘explores how one of the toughest battlegrounds in the culture wars of the 70s helped give rise to the Moral Majority and forever shifted our political landscape.’

Dahvi Waller is the mastermind behind the miniseries.

We’re absolutely ready to see some important history on the small screen and some (no doubt) stellar performances.

Filming is currently underway and the show is expected to be released in 2020.
